messages.message:
<!channel> we have received questions from multiple customers now on what is a standard process on moving binaries / solutions from one deployment to other (dev --> QA --> UAT --> Prod).  If we already have this process documents, it’d be great to share with the customer success team.  If not, is there anyone who wants to take the lead on writing this document.

<!subteam^SRYCC8P53> team since they’ll have a idea on how to standardize the process.

I want to make sure I am understanding correctly, this is the process of moving from different instances of instabase, and they are asking if they should do anything other than downloading the binary and uploading it to the next environment ?

@shaunak - Trying to understand the coupling between binaries and deployments. In other words, we definitely need to do UAT when the binary version changes, as well as the underlying platform changes.

This is not us, but our customers want to understand how they can take a `Flow Solution` from one deployment to another.  Currently, we don’t have an automated way to promoting such solutions, so we should give them a process.
@Justin correct, but with Marketplace is the `binary` the correct semantics, or is `solution` the correct semantics?

That makes sense. @Justin what I’ve seen customers want is “There are two changes to a Flow Solution. Either the platform changes (software update) or the Flow Solution logic itself changes (Flow Binary change). In either case, how do I ensure that the solution continues to work and won’t break my production pipeline and accuracy numbers?”
with marketplace, `solution`  is the correct semantics.

Got it. It's not in our next quarter roadmap to link physically separated instances together. We can help them with managing the process until deployed solutions is ready.

Yes what @Mohit said, `solutions` is the format our customers should be using :slightly_smiling_face:
Hari is working on a revamp of Test Runner, but we can still provide an intermediary solution where we can help ensure their Solutions / Binaries are still working correctly

Test runner would be the way to go in the long run. Customers can create UAT suites. If a platform is upgraded, they can simply run the suites. If the solution or flow binary is upgraded, they can add the new binary or solution to the Test suite and run them.  This could act as a single point of control for non flow / marketplace testing as well (for any UATs)
